channel.title: Question about ::yell Command

item.title: Question about ::yell Command
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && !muted) { String titles = ""; switch (playerRights) { case 0: if (donator == 0) titles = "[Player] "; else titles = "[DONATOR] "; break; case 1: titles = "[MOD] "; break; case 2: titles = "[ADMIN] "; break; case 3: titles = "[OWNER] "; break; case 4: titles = "[SERVER] "; break; } yell(titles + playerName + ": " + command.substring(5)); }

Read full topic

item.title: Question about ::yell Command
item.dc:creator: @QuestMaster_2K10 QuestMaster 2K10
item.description:
@QuestMaster_2K10 wrote:

Although case labeling is a good unique, this command is off. Create a substring for a new String variable, and parse the command input past " : " so it can read what the player actually types after the colon, : , to appear in a message. The rest you can figure yourself by using contextual clues.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about ::yell Command
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

I have a server that I want everyone to “::yell” and you do not have to be a donator to do so… So I was wondering where would I change this that it would be available for all people to “::yell”?

if(command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == false) { String titles = "";

if (donator >= 0) {
sM(“You need to be a donator to use Yell”);
} else {

switch (playerRights) {
case 0:
titles = "[DONATOR] ";
break;

case 1:
titles = "[MOD] ";
break;

case 2:
titles = "[ADMIN] ";
break;

case 3:
titles = "[OWNER] ";
break;

case 4:
titles = "[SERVER] ";
break;
}
yell(titles + playerName + ": " + command.substring(5));

Read full topic
